skill.name: pdf
skill.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/splitting documents, and handling forms. When Claude needs to fill in a PDF form or programmatically process, generate, or analyze PDF documents at scale.
skill.summary: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/sp...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: OFFICIAL skill from Anthropic. Code reviewed - uses standard PDF libraries (pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab) with proper input validation and no dangerous operations. All file I/O is through user-specified paths with validation.

content.value_statement: Extract data from PDFs, create new documents, merge/split files, and intelligently fill out forms using visual analysis and coordinate mapping.
actual_capabilities: Extract text and tables from PDFs with layout preservation
Fill fillable PDF form fields programmatically
Fill non-fillable PDF forms using visual bounding box analysis
Create new PDFs from scratch with text, tables, and formatting
Rotate, crop, and manipulate PDF pages
Convert PDF pages to images for visual analysis
Detect and validate form field locations with coordinate mapping
OCR scanned PDFs using image conversion
limitations: OCR for scanned PDFs requires additional dependencies (pytesseract, pdf2image)
Complex table extraction may require manual parameter tuning
Non-fillable form filling requires multi-step visual validation process
Some PDF viewers may not render annotations consistently
Password-protected PDFs require the password to process

use_cases.title: Document Assembly
use_cases.description: Merge multiple PDF documents, reorder pages, remove sensitive pages, and create combined reports or portfolios
use_cases.target_user: Legal professionals, project managers, compliance teams

use_cases.title: Batch Document Processing
use_cases.description: Process hundreds of PDFs to extract text, add watermarks, encrypt files, or convert to other formats at scale

best_practices: Always check if a PDF has fillable fields before attempting visual form filling
Validate bounding boxes with generated images before filling non-fillable forms
Use pdfplumber for table extraction instead of basic text extraction
Convert PDFs to images at appropriate resolution (300 DPI for forms, 150 DPI for preview)
Test filled forms in multiple PDF viewers to ensure compatibility
Use qpdf for command-line operations when processing many files
Handle encrypted PDFs by checking is_encrypted before processing
For scanned PDFs, use OCR (pytesseract) after converting to images
anti_patterns: Don't skip the visual validation step when filling non-fillable forms - bounding boxes must be verified
Don't use pypdf's basic extract_text() for complex layouts - use pdfplumber instead
Don't assume all form fields are fillable - always check first with check_fillable_fields.py
Don't create overlapping bounding boxes - labels and entry areas must not intersect
Don't process large PDFs entirely in memory - use page-by-page processing or splitting
Don't skip the automated intersection check (check_bounding_boxes.py) - it catches common errors

faq.question: How do I fill out a PDF form?
faq.answer: First run check_fillable_fields.py to determine if it has fillable fields. If yes, use extract_form_field_info.py and fill_fillable_fields.py. If no, follow the multi-step visual analysis process in forms.md: convert to images, identify field bounding boxes, create validation images, verify accuracy, then fill with annotations.

faq.question: Can this skill handle scanned PDFs?
faq.answer: Yes, but scanned PDFs require OCR. Convert the PDF to images using convert_pdf_to_images.py, then use pytesseract to extract text from the images.

faq.question: What's the difference between fillable and non-fillable forms?
faq.answer: Fillable forms have defined form fields that can be programmatically populated. Non-fillable forms are just visual layouts where you must determine field locations visually and add text annotations at the correct coordinates.

faq.question: Why do I need to validate bounding boxes?
faq.answer: Bounding box validation ensures text appears in the correct location without overlapping labels or other fields. The validation images show you exactly where text will be placed before creating the final PDF.

faq.question: Which library should I use for extracting tables?
faq.answer: Use pdfplumber - it's specifically designed for table extraction and handles complex layouts much better than basic text extraction libraries.

permissions: File system read access for input PDFs
File system write access for output PDFs and images
Temporary directory access for image conversion
